metadata.title: CVE-2020-27170 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.11.8.kernel/bpf/verifier.c performs undesirable out-of-bounds speculation onpointer arithmetic, leading to side-channel attacks that defeat Spectremitigations and obtain sensitive information from kernel memory, akaCID-f232326f6966. This affects pointer types that do not define aptr_limit.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27170` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-140-generic - 4.15.0-140.144~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-140-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-140.144~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-140-lowlatency - 4.15.0-140.144~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-140-generic - 4.15.0-140.144~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-140-lowlatency - 4.15.0-140.144~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1097-aws - 4.15.0-1097.104~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1111-azure - 4.15.0-1111.123~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1096-gcp - 4.15.0-1096.109~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1068-oracle - 4.15.0-1068.76~16.04.1
No subscription required
